p: Co-infections were considered by positive results on RT-PCR methodologies. Chikungunya virus monoinfections were identified in 51 out of 61 (83.6%) acute cases positive by RT-PCR, DENV-1 monoinfections were characterized in 11.4% (7/61), and DENV-4 monoinfections in 1.6% (1/61) of the positive cases. One case was characterized as CHIKV/DENV-1 co-infection and one as CHIKV/DENV-4 one, see Table 2.
